That equates to about 10k mAh worth of charge. I requested a replacement that I received this week and it provided even less than that. So if you are looking for an inexpensive 10k mAh charger then this fits the bill but if you need one that can truly charge your device 6+ times this does not seem to have the advertised capacity; a trend that seems to be all to common as a I search for a quality power bank.Edit: The replacement I received did not charge my phone two full times so it was less effective than the first one.

I received this item as a gift from my dad.  Here are my first impressions:There are no ports on the device labeled "input", even though the "instructions" claim there are 3.  The cord that comes with it fits into one of the ports, so we can surmise that is an input.  Great, now it is plugged in.  How do we know it is charging?  There is no blinky light or other such indication.  The "instructions" say there is a product diagram and that "2" is battery indicators.  Well, there is no product diagram, no photo to label where "2" is.I'm going to say that this is a knock off product straight from China and not from any reputable company that develops this sort of thing.  It is going back.

There are 3 ways to "input" or charge, and one way to charge your items, all slow usb-AThe instructions claim the battery can tell what your device needs and adjusts the charge accordingly but my phone that can be turbocharged charges as slow as my kindle.The led battery status lights are very bright, you can double click the button to turn it off but that also turns the battery off. It lights up my whole bedroom trying to change my kindle.It would have been more useful to be able to use the C-usb to charge a device instead of or in addition to "input".  Instead you have the choice of 3 usb-A slots to charge your devices.I used a meter to see how many watts was being used to charge the battery, the micro usb-A charged at 1 watt, the usc-C charged at 5 watts. I didn't try the fire slot.The instructions have a "product diagram" with names and numbers but no diagram.  I don't think the manufacturer knows the names of the different usb types, they all say "input" or "output".I got this one because it seemed like a good price for a large capacity but the design doesn't make sense and it seems to be false advertising. I'm sending it back and getting a different power bank from a reputable manufacturer.

Bonjour, je suis Copilot, un assistant virtuel. Je peux vous aider à améliorer votre avis de batterie. Voici une version plus concise et plus claire de votre avis, avec un titre:Batterie pratique pour le voyage, mais pas très performante ni solideCette batterie peut recharger quatre fois votre téléphone, mais elle a aussi des défauts. L’usb c n’est pas une sortie, donc elle ne peut pas recharger un Mac, contrairement à ce que certains avis disent. La sortie électrique est lente, la batterie est lourde et imposante. Elle est aussi fragile, le bouton ne marche plus et elle ne fonctionne plus chez moi.Pour le prix, c’est correct, mais pas exceptionnel. Par contre, elle est pratique pour le voyage, mais ne passe pas dans une sacoche, ni un sac à main, encore moins dans votre poche. Vous aurez le choix entre la porter, (cela ressemble à une brique pour être honnête, et elle glisse) ou bien dans votre sac à dos.
Produit efficace les 3 premiers mois mais la batterie ce dégrade très vite

reviewTitle: Tested capacity 12569mAh at 5 volts and 2 amps.
reviewDescription: Weird that one USB-A port is upside-down.Two units charged full, discharged at 5 volts and 2 amps to empty, total output 12523 and 12616mAh respectively.  Average 12569, which is 63 watt-hours.  Figuring losses to make 3.7 volts from battery into 5 volts, this is actually a 20,000mAh power bank and the manufacturer lies.

reviewTitle: Robust and Reliable – JIGA 30000mAh Power Bank Exceeds Expectations
reviewDescription: I recently purchased the JIGA 30000mAh Power Bank, which has quickly become crucial to my tech arsenal. Its massive capacity and fast charging capabilities have changed the way I manage my devices daily.One of the standout features of this power bank is its Fast Charging technology. With a 22.5W output, I've boosted my phone's battery from 15% to 60% in just 30 minutes, significantly faster than other chargers I've used. This speed is perfect for quick top-ups during busy days.The high-density polymer battery offers a high capacity and is compact, making the power bank easy to carry despite its power. I've kept my phone and other devices fully charged all day, which is essential for my work and travel..Another great feature is the versatility of having multiple ports. With three outputs and two inputs, I can charge multiple devices simultaneously. The built-in LED lights are helpful for monitoring the charge level, and the green light indicator for fast charging is a nice touch, confirming that my devices are charging quickly.Moreover, the built-in flashlight has been surprisingly helpful during my outdoor adventures and power outages, providing sufficient light when needed.Safety is also a priority with this power bank. It comes equipped with several protection features to ensure safe charging, which gives me peace of mind, especially when charging overnight.In conclusion, the JIGA 30000mAh Power Bank is an excellent choice for anyone looking for a reliable and fast charging solution. It's powerful, versatile, and safe, making it a valuable gadget for anyone’s tech collection. Plus, the customer support is responsive and helpful, adding to the overall positive experience with this product.

Je suis informaticien et teste régulièrement tout type de produit de manière impartiale, afin de proposer le meilleur rapport qualité prix à mes clients .A savoir que tout appareil avec une batterie litium nécessite 2 a 3 charge minimum pour que toute la chimie de la batterie se fasse et qu on obtienne l autonomie annoncée , qu il faut éviter de decharger  la batterie en dessous de 30% et il faudrait dans la théorie ne pas la charger au delà de 80%.Résultat du test :Tromperie ou erreur sur la capacité énergétique déjà , 30 000mah, c’est faux, sur la batterie , il est indiqué 99.9Wh soit 20 000mah. Et après plusieurs charges, on obtiens 19 000mah.La dernier voyant ne s allume pas comme si la batterie ne pouvait recharger jusqu’à ses 100%.Coté charge, elle charge bien et la fonction PD ou CHARGE RAPIDE est bien fonctionnelle.Les connectiques ne sont pas tous présent (Apple manquant ) mais peu d importance vu que l usb-c va devenir la norme universelle.En résumé , si elle avait réellement ses 30 000mah,et qu elle pouvait charger à bloc, ça aurait été un bon produitMerci de m avoir lu

Die Powerbank geht manchmal einfach aus und läd nicht weiter, obwohl noch 3 Punkte leuchten, also da noch ca. 50% drin sein soll. Ich wollte dann jetzt die Powerbank wieder aufladen und das hat natürlich immer seine Zeit gedauert, aber diesmal hatte ich die Powerbank 2 Tage lang angeschlossen und sie war niemals voll.Ich werde diese Powerbank nicht mehr weiter benutzen, da ich bedenken wegen der Lithium Batterie darin habe und habe mir eine andere gekauft, die sowohl dünner, als auch leichter ist.

reviewTitle: TEXAS SIZE POWER BANK!!! Best one I've owned so far.
reviewDescription: I ordered this one for two reason,1. 30000mAh is plenty for a few big smart phones and tablets. 2. Caught it during a flash sale for a VERY GOOD DEAL!! so duh...had to buy it. 3. We are planning a few camping trips so doesn't hurt to have a nice potent portable Juice pack. It's pretty bulky and has quite the mass to it so if you are planning on carrying it in the pocket make sure you have some deep ones and you wear a good belt!. But should be fine in any back pack pocket. Real estate is about the same as any Plus size smart phone out there and as thick as about 2.5 phones stacked on top of each other.I tested it with my s10+ at about 10% battery left and took about 1hr20min to fully charged and battery indicator light was still with all 5 lights on. As soon as I plug in my other phone it went to 4 lights but fully charged that one also and still had four lights. So...it's fair to say that it could handle at least up to 5 charges on one phone. I've yet to try multiples at the same time. The light is farely bright for what it is, I'd say abou 200-300 lumens...??(he'll do I know, right) enoughy to find loose change under the couch! lol. I also liked the fact that it has a lightning port as a power input to charge the device additional to the usual micro USB. One draw back and is the only thing wrong with mine and the reason for the over all 4 stars....the lightning port on mine is sitting either in too deep or has some play, I have to wiggle the cable in order for it to start charging and if the cable moves it stops. It will not hook up just by simple pluging it in, the Micro USB on the other hand...worked like a charm all the time (shown in pictures). If not it would be a SOLID 5 STARS; but hey..nothing is perfect. Other than that, this thing is awesome. I definitely recommend this JIGA power bank, and even more so if you can buy it for under $30 like I did!!!!

reviewTitle: This power bank deserves 10 stars! Best price point and product, Perfect for emergencies!
reviewDescription: I wish I could rate this higher than 5 stars!  With the full price of only $26.95, and ability to use coupons to get an even better deal, this portable USB C charger is the best deal and value among all power banks. My partner and I are Portable Charger Power Bank Connoisseurs, we have a total of about 10 power banks of various types, sizes and power output.  This is by far the biggest mAh output that we have so far, and for such a reasonable price.This Power bank is perfect for every day use, business and leisure travel, camping and emergencies.  We can charge up all of our devices quickly with the fast charging function, and still have enough battery to charge them up again once it they die, as well as still use the flashlight for hours.  You can charge multiple items simultaneously,  and use the flashlight function as well.  This is essential for a bug out bag, ruck sack, emergency kit, keep one for each vehicle and back pack.  With 2 original USB outputs to charge any type of device, as well as a USB C Input and Output to be able to quickly charge your devices or recharge your battery pack, as well as a micro USB input to be able to recharge your power bank.
I use my smart devices for work and business,and sometimes I'm not near electrical outlets, so this item is extremely useful!

reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Value priced, meets or exceeds description, works as advertised and is a value.
reviewDescription: I purchase several things on Amazon and was giving pretty in-depth reviews. From this point on, here's the new agenda…. if it works as advertised, is well made, meets or exceeds the description, is a value, and arrives in a fair amount of time, it will get a "star rating" equal to what my expectations were/are. If it doesn't meet these criteria, then I will most definitely and descriptively tell the short comings of the products and you as a consumer will not have to go through the trouble of buying the product without some background knowledge. If the sell pulls that item and relists under another description, I will put the exact same review on the seller's feedback page. Sellers have done this a couple of times in the past, and I was true to my word then as well as now. DR

I am a real estate agent who spends a lot of time out and about, often in homes that don't have wifi or electricity in some cases. I used it non-stop for two days straight and still had 60-80% left so I’ll be able to use it for weeks at a time without worrying about having to recharge it, which only takes a few hours anyway. reviewTitle: Not much use to me, and will be returned.
reviewDescription: Well, I tried...  I tried to find out what the actual maximum output current was, but failed.  I asked the question here on the Amazon product page but no one answered.  I also read a professional review that said one could charge the battery pack faster by charging it via its multiple inputs.I just tested it though and found rather disappointing current levels.  It is described as having 3x 2.1A USB outputs.  But what does 3x 2.1A equal?  In this case it equals about 2.1A.  2.1A is the maximum TOTAL output across all three USB sockets.  So if you are charging three devices, they will all charge rather slowly, especially as the voltage drops well below 5v as the current rises.  If you wanted to charge three low power devices, like a  couple of older phones and a bluetooth speaker, you might be alright.But worse than that, the maximum input current is very low.  I didn't try via the USB-C port as I did not have a USB-C cable, but via either the Apple Lightning input or the Micro USB input (you can't use both together as the sockets are too close to each other) the absolute maximum current the battery bank will accept is 1.8A.  That is with the supplied short (30cm?) Micro USB cable.  With longer cables I tried the current was below 1.0A.  The charger I used was a very good quality USB charger well capable of producing about 3.5A without the voltage dropping below about 5.1v, so it is definitely the battery bank itself which is limiting the current flow.The other thing is that it doesn't look like pass-through charging is possible.  At least, it didn't work for me.  An iphone charged fine from the battery bank when it was not plugged into the wall charger, but as soon as the wall charger was connected to the battery bank the iphone said something about "accessory not supported," and the charging symbol disappeared from the iphone's screen.So, a bit disappointing, but this power bank is clearly not going to do what I need it to do, so I shall be returning it.  I've given it one star (on top of the one compulsory star) because it does seem to work.  It's just very slow, and I'm not sure why anyone would buy such a large battery bank if they only needed to charge low power devices.  A large bank should also be reasonably powerful, and this one just isn't.

reviewTitle: Cheep plasticy battery with high capacity.
reviewDescription: Main reason I bought it, is the enormous capacity.  In general it feels placticy and cheaply build. It is not water proof or shock resistant. I'm afraid that if I accidentally drop it, it will fall a part. If you are care for your stuff, sturdiness should not be a problem.  Too bad the outputs are only USB-A type, but the high variety of inputs is great. Definitely make this battery super universal.  Yes, it's heavy, but that's understandable for 30 000 mAh and if you like camping in the woods this one should be enough to feed you phone for days.  I don't have it from a long time, so cannot say about the self-discharging.  For me the biggest disappointment is from Amazon. My battery seems to be used or at least sold and probably return. The box was definitely opened before. It is even damaged on both sides. Anyway, I decides to keep it since no severe marks of usage are present.Update after 6 months: I bought this battery in July with an intend to use it during my summer holiday, and I did so. For two weeks I charger my phone couple of times out of it and recharge the battery itself two times. After that I barely used it. It was mainly sitting in my desk with out 75% charge in it. Until December I used it probably two or three times. For your information I have an iPhone with a 2200mAh battery.  Currently in the last 10 days I had to use it and from a full power bank I barely recharged my phone six times, starting from 20% to 100%, and the power bank was empty. If I do the math seems that the power bank has more or less half of the capacity it's rated for. Even if we consider some percentage of energy loss due to the transfer, this is still a significant deviation.

You have to accept the fact that while technically accurate, the mAh ratings on all power packs, with a few exceptions, are NOT accurate regarding what people expect. On the back of this unit it clearly says "30000 mAh / 3.7V". Well, you divide 3.7 volts by 5 volts and you get 0.74. Now, multiply 30,000 * 0.74 and you get 22,200, which is about the mAh I've gotten out of this. This math works for most all of them too. Also, they used to rate these things in Amp/hours too but figured out most people think 30,000 mAh is so much more so they all started doing it. This same unit is actually 30,000,000 microamp / hours.Overall it seems to be a good unit. It's large and heavy but you have to expect that for the capacity. It takes quite a while to charge because of the capacity but should last quite a few phone charges. I like it and I'm happy with my purchase, at this point. We'll see what the future holds.
